alert.note: Alert for Western El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:27PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Dona Ana and northwestern El Paso Counties through 1130 PM MDT... At 1024 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms developing across much of southern Dona Ana County. These storms are moving to the northeast at 15 to 20 mph and could impact parts of Las Cruces and west El Paso in the next hour. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, Santa Teresa, Anthony, Vado, Las Cruces, Sunland Park, NMSU Main Campus, Afton, Canutillo, Vinton, Mesquite, Mesilla, Chamberino, San Miguel, La Union, Fairacres, La Mesa. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 113 and 145. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 4 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
